alert.note: Alert for Menifee; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Powell, southeastern Montgomery and southwestern Menifee Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cat Creek, or near Stanton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Means, Cedar Groves and Haystack around 1245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Fagan, Cornwell, Tabor and Rothwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
